thread.title: Pinnacle hangs on for 34-33 win over Boulder Creek after missed PAT
thread.title_full: Pinnacle hangs on for 34-33 win over Boulder Creek after missed PAT

author: azcentral.com
title: Pinnacle hangs on for 34-33 win over Boulder Creek after missed PAT
text:
Phoenix Pinnacle needed some good fortune to escape winless Anthem Boulder Creek 34-33 in its homecoming Thursday night in front of a capacity crowd.
Pinnacle (4-3) got down in the first quarter, got up by 11 at halftime, then could breathe easier with 1:07 left after watching Boulder Creek's point-after-touchdown kick sail wide in the Division I game.
"We're lucky," Pinnacle coach Dana Zupke said. "That game should have went to overtime, and I don't know if we deserved to win this game, but we did."
AZCENTRAL
6:30 p.m. Friday: Week 3 HS football updates
For the second week in a row, Pinnacle nearly got stung by a winless team.
Peoria Liberty picked up its first win last week with a victory over Pinnacle.
Boulder Creek (0-7) now faces what amounts to a play-in game to make the 16-team playoffs in a 17-team division next week when it plays host to Phoenix Horizon, the only other Division I team without a win.
"I think we'll win next week, absolutely," said Boulder Creek quarterback Gunther Johnson, who had a remarkable second half, passing for 265 yards and two touchdowns and engineering a 16-play, 78-yard scoring drive that was capped by Willie Muller's 1-yard run with 1:07 left. "We haven't had a half like that since last year.
"Even though we lost, it feels great the way we played."
RELATED: High school football scoreboard | Nominate the best Fan Experience
Just in the third quarter, Johnson was 14 of 17 for 215 yards and two touchdowns and converted a two-point play with a dash into the end zone that gave Boulder Creek a 27-24 lead.
After freshman quarterback Spencer Rattler was 12 of 17 for 238 yards and three TDs in the first half, Pinnacle (4-3) relied on a run game in the second half, as Rattler attempted just nine more passes, completing six for 65 yards.
But Rattler found Dalton Cash for a big 23-yard pass play that kept alive an 80-yard scoring drive that Nick Ferrara capped with a 3-yard run that gave Pinnacle a 31-27 lead with 9:40 left.
Pinnacle, which ran the ball 15 times for 74 yards in the second half, had a chance to put the game away after Justin Mandrola ran 22 yards to the 1.
AZCENTRAL
Pick the Preps high school football pick'em contest
But Boulder Creek stuffed Pinnacle on two running plays, and Rattler's perfect pass in the corner of the end zone to Anthony Vaughn was broken up at the last second by Nicholas Angieri. Pinnacle settled for Jeffrey McGuire's 19-yard field goal for a 34-27 lead with 6:29 to play.
"That puts the game away," Zupke said. "We're a young team and that's something we have to keep working on."
Boulder Creek moved the ball for the first time in the final quarter with Johnson picking apart the secondary with short passes to his receivers, particularly Troy Reed, Jacob Christofferson and Tristen D'Angelo.
"I have to hand it to them, they made a great second-half adjustment, throwing quick on us and pulled us out of our blitz," Zupke said.
